did.abstract: Ann Arbor German-American family, owners of the Allmendinger Organ Company which later became the Ann Arbor Organ Company. Correspondence, scrapbooks, family genealogy, photographs concerning family affairs, materials on Helene Allmendinger's radio show, examples of spirit messages received by Helene Allmendinger from deceased family members; information pertaining to the Ann Arbor Organ Company, and family members still living in Germany.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Allmendinger family members (donor nos. 5606, 9434, 10257).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Allmendinger Family Papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: David F. and Marie (nee Garttner) Allmendinger were long-time residents of Ann Arbor, Michigan. David Allmendinger (1848-1916) emigrated from Germany in 1851 at the age of three. He was trained as a cabinet-maker and later learned the craft of organ manufacture. In 1872, he started his own business, the Allmendinger Organ Company, which later became the Ann Arbor Organ Company. His son Herman D. Allmendinger (1873-1945) worked with the company, then in 1915, he established his own business, the Allmendinger Music Shop which he managed until he sold the firm in 1929. Another of David and Marie's children, Helene Allmendinger (1878-1973), was a singer, composer of music, and a Spiritualist.

scopecontent.p: The collection is divided into the following series: Family records and correspondence; Helene Allmendinger papers; Ina Allmendinger papers; Ann Arbor Organ Company; Harriet Birch papers, Other family members; Miscellaneous, and Photographs.

Family records and correspondence includes family history information collected and compiled by Ina Allmendinger, wife of Martin N. Allmendinger. Genealogical research materials produced by other members of the family comprise portions of the series. This series also contains family correspondence, sometimes referred to as "round robins" by the Allmendingers. These letters were sent between extended family members, frequently as a form letter, but were also addressed to specific family members. In casual correspondence between family members, these letters were often referred to as "R.R.," for "round robin." Family records and correspondence also includes material from Marie Garttner and other relatives on the maternal side of the D.F. Allmendinger family.

did.unittitle: Collected records of Clara, Ruth, Olga (died as infant), and Victor Allmendinger
Family history questionnaires for Rosa, Emma Cornelia, and Martin Allmendinger
Ina Allmendinger's duplicate copy of the Allmendinger Family History

scopecontent.p: The Helene Allmendinger papers contain material related to her musical career, as well as her interest in and practice of Spiritualism. Biographical material is available in the form of scrapbooks and diaries. Helene Allmendinger is heavily represented in the photograph series, which provides additional biographical context. The series also includes correspondence with friends, fans of her musical performances on the WJR radio station, as well as some family correspondence.

odd.p: (includes 1929 letter discussing family tensions regarding money)

did.unittitle: Correspondence with Muller family in Europe 1946-1973
Correspondence concerning Helene Allmendinger's W.J.R. radio show 1928
Helene Allmendinger scrapbook containing clippings, programs of her performances, photographs, and memorabilia, circa 1899-1957
"In lieu of last will and testament," 1965

scopecontent.p: The Ina Allmendinger papers contain two sub-series, Correspondence and Family History. Correspondence consists of letters to and from Ina and various D.F. Allmendinger descendants. As Family Historian, Ina prepared and mailed out Family History Questionnaires to the extended Allmendinger family, in an effort to collect genealogical data. As a result, much of the correspondence included in her papers relate to family history. The Family History sub-series consists of non-correspondence items that illustrate some aspect of Allmendinger history, both in Germany and the U.S.

odd.p: (includes letters from Paul Burk to Helene Muller)
(includes letters from Paul Dalke and Dorothy Meyers)

did.unittitle: Harriet Birch and other Birch family members 1970-1989 (scattered dates)

odd.p: (bulk of correspondence is between Ina and Ruth McClusky Jones)
(includes correspondence regarding transfer of family records to the Bentley Historical Library)

did.unittitle: Eleanor Schmidt Dorstewitz and family 1974-1989 (scattered dates)

odd.p: (includes German map of Stuttgart with underlined locations of family interest)

scopecontent.p: Ann Arbor Organ Company includes assorted correspondence, background information and articles, as well as material pertaining to business operations of the company. News clippings about the company can also be found in the series.

did.unittitle: Catalogs, specifications, drawings, and financial materials

scopecontent.p: The Harriet Birch papers include family correspondence between Allmendinger relatives. Harriet (1922-2008), a granddaughter of David F. Allmendinger, was the daughter of Floyd Wuerth and Rosa Allmendinger Wuerth. Her papers consist of correspondence to Allmendinger descendents in Germany, as well as to Ina Allmendinger and Eleanor Dorstewitz. Biographical information is also available, including a "Life Reading" that Harriet ordered from a Washington state couple.

did.unittitle: Muller family history and related correspondence 1985-1995

odd.p: (includes correspondence between Don Gaerttner and Dorothy Wagner)
(to Harriet and Carol Birch; includes photographs)

scopecontent.p: Other family members contains material from other Allmendinger family members, including a memoir (both finished and manuscript version) from Ruth Allmendinger Schmidt, correspondence from Rosa Wuerth concerning the old-age care of Marie Kolberg, correspondence from Don and Georgia Gaerttner, extended family of Marie Garttner, wife of D.F. Allmendinger, and records of the Wagner and Murray families.

did.unittitle: Memoir, "This is the story of my life," by Ruth Allmendinger Schmidt
Manuscript, "This is the story of my life," by Ruth Allmendinger Schmidt 1962
Supplemental material on David F. Allmendinger, Jr.

odd.p: (includes legal documents regarding Dorothy Wagner estate)

scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous includes printed matter about the Limpert family (Ina Allmendinger's maiden name was Limpert), assorted miscellanea, and documents from the Washtenaw Abstract Company. Also includes an audio tape recording of an interview with Helene Allmendinger.

did.unittitle: Washtenaw Abstract Company, Statement of Title and Deeds 1824-1944
Audiotape of interview with Helene Allmendinger conducted by Johanna Wiese circa 1960s

scopecontent.p: The Photographs series contain photographs of the David F. Allmendinger family, as well as more recent snapshots and portraits from his scattered descendants. For the six folders of photos of the D.F. Allmendinger family, 1881-1943, the donor has supplied identifications. In addition, the donor assigned identification numbers to these images. Helene, Charles, George F., Marie, David F., Robert C., and Rosa Allmendinger are among the family members depicted in the photographs. Photographs of Marie Kolberg, Harriet Birch, and the Karl Muller family are also included. Pictures of the Ann Arbor Organ Company also comprise a part of this series.

odd.p: (includes photocopy of print of Wuerth Theater, Ann Arbor, ca. 1940)

did.unittitle: Family and Allmendinger Organ Shop photograph album

odd.p: (identifications and identification nos. supplied by the donor)
